title: Beetroot and Feta Pearl Barley Risotto
description: A vibrant and nourishing risotto, where the usual arborio rice is swapped for the fibre rich pearl barley. It's delicious as a vegetarian main, but would also be very nice served alongside some smoked mackerel or smoked trout.
method: Preheat the oven to 180c/160c fan/gas mark 4.
Peel, halve and finely chop the onion, and finely dice the celery. Peel and chop the beetroot into 1 inch square chunks.
Heat a large frying pan with 1-2 tbsp of olive oil over a high heat. When the pan is hot, add the chopped onion and celery. Cook for about 8 minutes, until softened slightly. Stir often.
Meanwhile, crush the garlic and remove the thyme leaves from the stalk, discarding the stalks.
Place the beetroot on an oiled baking tray, and place in the oven for around 30 minutes, until the beetroot is cooked through.
Add the garlic and thyme leaves to the onion, and cook for a further two minutes, stir frequently.
Boil the kettle for the vegetable stock. Mix together 1 litre of water with 1 vegetable stock cube.

Add the pearl barley and stir to coat the granules. Add the stock, increase the heat and bring to a boil. Reduce to a simmer then cook for about 30 minutes, until all the liquid as been absorbed and the pearl barley is tender. You may need to add more water/stock if the pearl barley is not cooked.
Meanwhile, place the cooked beetroot and a pinch of salt into the bowl of a food processor / blender. Blend until smooth, you may need to stop and scrape the bowl down a few times.
Once the pearl barley is cooked and dry, stir through the beetroot puree. Taste for seasoning.
Drizzle over some olive oil and serve with crumbled feta on top.
